sentences.sContent: A baby communicates its needs by crying.
...that’s a powerful lesson on how important it can be to accurately communicate to each other...
...and we have more freedoms than ever: we can wear what we like and communicate with hundreds of friends at once at the click of a mouse...
...It is common that youngsters nowadays incline to communicate with others on internet increasingly...
...What he tried to do was to teach a male dolphin called Bass and a female called Doris to communicate with each other across a solid barrier...
...we can communicate with others anytime via internet...
...and then have them communicate that information to their peers...
...But just as important is her ability to communicate with people through public speaking...

remMethod.val: com(共同) ＋ mun(服务) ＋ icate(做) → 互相服务 → 交流， 交际

words.tran: 可传达的；会传染的；爱说话的
通讯，[通信] 通信；交流
通知者；报导者；领受圣餐者
交流；传播（communicate的现在分词）；传递

trans.tranCn: 通讯， 交际， 交流； 连接， 相通； 传达， 传播； 传染
trans.tranOther: to express your thoughts and feelings clearly, so that other people understand them
